io.radar.sdk

Class Radar

  • io.radar.sdk.Radar

  • public class Radar

    The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Radar INSTANCE
      The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId, java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)
      Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns the current description.
      void getLocation(Radar.RadarLocationCallback callback)
      Gets the device's current location.
      void getLocation(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super java.lang.Boolean,kotlin.Unit> block)
      Gets the device's current location.
      org.json.JSONObject getMetadata()
      Returns the current metadata.
      RadarTrackingOptions getTrackingOptions()
      Returns the current tracking options.
      java.lang.String getUserId()
      Returns the current userId.
      void initialize(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String publishableKey)
      Initializes the Radar SDK. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.
      boolean isTracking()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.
      void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      void searchGeofences(int radius, java.lang.String[] tags, java.lang.Integer limit, Radar.RadarSearchGeofencesCallback callback)
      Gets the device's current location, then searches for geofences near that location, sorted by distance.

      Gets the device's current location, then searches for geofences near that location, sorted by distance.
      void searchGeofences(android.location.Location location, int radius, java.lang.String[] tags, java.lang.Integer limit, Radar.RadarSearchGeofencesCallback callback)
      Search for geofences near a location, sorted by distance.
      void searchGeofences(android.location.Location location, int radius, java.lang.String[] tags, java.lang.Integer limit, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarGeofence[],kotlin.Unit> block)
      Search for geofences near a location, sorted by distance.

      Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

      Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

      Search for places near a location, sorted by distance.
      void searchPlaces(android.location.Location location, int radius, java.lang.String[] chains, java.lang.String[] categories, java.lang.String[] groups, java.lang.Integer limit, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarPlace[],kotlin.Unit> block)
      Search for places near a location, sorted by distance.
      void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
      Sets an optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard.
      void setLogLevel(Radar.RadarLogLevel level)
      Sets the log level for debug logs.
      void setMetadata(org.json.JSONObject metadata)
      Sets an optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.
      void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
      Identifies the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.
      void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions options)
      Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user should have granted backgroundlocation permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      void stopTracking()
      Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      java.lang.String stringForSource(Radar.RadarLocationSource source)
      Returns a display string for a location source value.
      void trackOnce(Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)
      Tracks the user's location once in the foreground.
      void trackOnce(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)
      Tracks the user's location once in the foreground.
      void trackOnce(android.location.Location location, Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)
      Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.
      void trackOnce(android.location.Location location, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)
      Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static Radar INSTANCE

        The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                       java.lang.String publishableKey)

        Initializes the Radar SDK. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.

        Parameters:
        context - The context
        publishableKey - Your publishable API key
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize

      • setUserId

        public void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)

        Identifies the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.

        Parameters:
        userId - A stable unique ID for the user. If null, the previous userId will be cleared.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId()

        Returns the current userId.

        Returns:
        The current userId.

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)

        Sets an optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard.

        Parameters:
        description - A description for the user. If null, the previous description will be cleared.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()

        Returns the current description.

        Returns:
        The current description.

      • setMetadata

        public void setMetadata(org.json.JSONObject metadata)

        Sets an optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.

        Parameters:
        metadata - A set of custom key-value pairs for the user. Must have 16 or fewer keys and values of type string, boolean, or number. If null, the previous metadata will be cleared.

      • getMetadata

        public org.json.JSONObject getMetadata()

        Returns the current metadata.

        Returns:
        The current metadata.

      • getLocation

        public void getLocation(Radar.RadarLocationCallback callback)

        Gets the device's current location.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional callback.

        Tracks the user's location once in the foreground.

      • trackOnce

        public void trackOnce(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)

        Parameters:
        block - A block callback.

      • trackOnce

        public void trackOnce(android.location.Location location,
                      Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)

        Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

        Parameters:
        location - A location for the user.
        callback - An optional callback.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual

      • trackOnce

        public void trackOnce(android.location.Location location,
                      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)

        Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

        Parameters:
        location - A location for the user.
        block - An a block callback.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual

      • startTracking

        public void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions options)

        Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user should have granted backgroundlocation permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        Parameters:
        options - Configurable tracking options.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background

      • stopTracking

        public void stopTracking()

        Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background

      • isTracking

        public boolean isTracking()

        Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.

        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.

      • getTrackingOptions

        public RadarTrackingOptions getTrackingOptions()

        Returns the current tracking options.

        Returns:
        The current tracking options.

      • acceptEvent

        public void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                        java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)

        Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to accept.
        verifiedPlaceId - For place entry events, the ID of the verified place. May be null.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • rejectEvent

        public void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)

        Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to reject.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • searchPlaces

        public void searchPlaces(int radius,
                         java.lang.String[] chains,
                         java.lang.String[] categories,
                         java.lang.String[] groups,
                         java.lang.Integer limit,
                         Radar.RadarSearchPlacesCallback callback)

        Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to search, in meters. A number between 100 and 10000.
        chains - An array of chain slugs to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains
        categories - An array of categories to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories
        groups - An array of groups to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        callback - A callback.

      • searchPlaces

        public void searchPlaces(int radius,
                         java.lang.String[] chains,
                         java.lang.String[] categories,
                         java.lang.String[] groups,
                         java.lang.Integer limit,
                         kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarPlace[],kotlin.Unit> block)

        Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to search, in meters. A number between 100 and 10000.
        chains - An array of chain slugs to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains
        categories - An array of categories to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories
        groups - An array of groups to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        block - A block callback.

        chains - An array of chain slugs to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains
        categories - An array of categories to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories
        groups - An array of groups to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        callback - A callback.

      • searchGeofences

        public void searchGeofences(int radius,
                            java.lang.String[] tags,
                            java.lang.Integer limit,
                            Radar.RadarSearchGeofencesCallback callback)

        Gets the device's current location, then searches for geofences near that location, sorted by distance.

        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to search, in meters. A number between 100 and 10000.
        tags - An array of tags to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/geofences
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        callback - A callback.
